Description: Small fragment of a glass vessel, parts of the body preserved with a protruding lug. The glass has a shiny blue colour, partly eroded, with a cream-whitish line decoration. Probably a very inner small diameter but the small fragment does not allow a very precise measurement.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E4.2, north of "tower"
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
